author: Uesley Durães;
title: chuva SP sem energia elétrica
text: Durante o temporal que atingiu São Paulo no início da noite desta quinta-feira (2), mais de 50 mil imóveis em São Paulo ficaram sem energia elétrica. Segundo boletim da Enel, 53.082 residências estão sem energia. O boletim foi atualizado às 20 horas, após temporal que atingiu a capital paulista e região metropolitana nesta quinta-feira. Situação mais crítica foi registrada na capital. Em São Paulo, segundo a Enel, 31.486 imóveis estão sem energia elétrica. Na sequência, Cotia tem mais de 15 mil imóveis sem energia elétrica, segundo a concessionária. O número representa uma fatia de 10,7% de todas as unidades consumidoras da cidade — 140.768. Outras 22 cidades da região metropolitana de São Paulo registraram queda de energia. A informação é do boletim da Enel das 20 horas. O UOL tenta contato com a Enel para saber detalhes sobre as ocorrências de queda de energia. Havendo resposta, o texto será atualizado. No início da noite desta quinta, a capital paulista esteve em estado de alerta para o temporal que atingiu a cidade. Ao todo, oito regiões paulistanas entraram em atenção para alagamentos, de acordo com o CGE (Centro de Gerenciamento de Emergências Climáticas). De acordo com o CGE, o temporal com ventos fortes desta quinta se deu pelo tempo abafado e chegada de brisa marítima. Segundo o Centro, foram formadas áreas de instabilidade em toda Grande São Paulo durante a tarde e a noite. Raios e rajadas de vento também foram registrados pelo radar meteorológico da Prefeitura de São Paulo. Até o momento, não foram registradas ocorrências envolvendo quedas de árvores ou alagamentos na capital.

author: Annie Haines
title: Benjamín Vicuña y Anita Espasandín se muestran muy enamorados en sus vacaciones en Japón
text:
Mientras que la China Suárez es tendencia en las redes sociales y protagoniza todos los portales debido a los escándalos que la envuelven por su romance con Mauro Icardi y por el conflicto con Wanda Nara,
Benjamín Vicuña disfruta de unas merecidas vacaciones en Japón junto a su actual novia, Anita Espasandín.
Cabe destacar que el actor tuvo un año muy movilizado debido a su agenda laboral, ya que trabajó en la serie de Netflix "Envidiosa", también actuó en la película "El silencio de Marcos Tremmer" y en la serie de Disney+ "La voz ausente", por lo que se fue al continente asiático a disfrutar de unos días totalmente diferentes con Espasandín, con quien blanqueó este 2024.
Además, en sus redes sociales, el artista chileno comparte diversas fotos de su viaje, aunque, en su mayoría, son de la ciudad de Tokio. Sin embargo, este jueves, publicó en su cuenta de Instagram un video repasando algunos momentos de sus vacaciones.
"Mucho tiempo pensando y deseando conocer esta cultura hermosa, un pueblo educado y reservado. Las personas son el centro de gravedad de toda sociedad, porque sus problemas y necesidades definen su lógica", escribió el actor.
"Existe una filosofía en su identidad de respetar la fragilidad, las cicatrices y las marcas del tiempo.
Fui un turista que pude perderme en sus calles e intentar entender algo de su mirada, la empatia con el otro, la belleza de lo simple, del minimalismo, la grandeza del momento presente y el ahora", finalizó Vicuña.
A su vez, en las imágenes que subió, se pudo ver cómo disfrutaba de los paisajes, de los transportes públicos de la capital de Japón, de la gente con la que se encontraba en la calle, de los monumentos y también con Espasandín, en donde mostró lo enamorados que están y siempre con una sonrisa de oreja a oreja.
El look fashionista de Anita Espasandín para pasear por Tokio con Benjamín Vicuña
Anita Espasandín viajó a Japón con Benjamín Vicuña. La empresaria y el actor se dieron el gusto de armar las valijas y trasladarse nada menos que a Tokio, para disfrutar de unos días a pura pasión.
La pareja viene de pasar una
vacaciones familiares en Chile, donde viajaron junto a los hijos que Vicuña tuvo con Pampita y con la China Suárez. Allí, Anita pudo conocer a la familia de su pareja, quienes residen en Santiago.
Pero, al finalizar la primera quincena de enero y tras dejar a los chicos con sus madres, el actor y su novia volvieron a armar las valijas para darse el gusto de viajar nada menos que a la tierra del sol naciente.
Y mientras que Benjamín compartió fotos de su primera recorrida por Tokio -se lo ve caminando por distintos puntos de la ciudad-, Espasandín compartió una imagen de su look.
Tras arribar a Tokio e instalarse en el hotel reservado, la pareja decidió salir a conocer la ciudad. Y para esa primera recorrida, Espasandín optó por un look por demás fashionista de chaleco y pantalón de Natalia Antolín.
Se trata de un equipo sastrero bicolor, en rosa con estampa de motivos selváticos en negro. La empresaria lo llevó con una polera negra y borcegos al tono, más anteojos y guantes de cuero.
En tanto que Vicuña optó por pantalón sastrero en azul oscuro, suéter al tono y campera de cuero de Zadig and Voltaire, más zapatillas.

author: Zacks Investment Research
title: Natural Gas Jumps as Cold Blast Spurs Heating Demand - January 15, 2024 - Zacks.com
text:
The U.S. Energy Department's weekly inventory release showed a higher-than-expected decrease in natural gas supplies. The bullish inventory numbers, together with a cold blast sweeping through North America drove up weather-related demand and buoyed natural gas futures, which settled with another healthy gain week over week.
Despite the spike, the market hasn't been kind to natural gas, with the commodity trading considerably lower over the past 12 months over growing worries about record output and concerns of an ongoing supply glut. At this time, we advise investors to focus on stocks like Range Resources ( RRC Quick Quote RRC - Free Report ) , Coterra Energy ( CTRA Quick Quote CTRA - Free Report ) and Cheniere Energy ( LNG Quick Quote LNG - Free Report ) .
EIA Reports a Withdrawal Bigger Than Market Expectations Stockpiles held in underground storage in the lower 48 states fell 140 billion cubic feet (Bcf) for the holiday-shortened week ended Jan 5, above the guidance of a 122 Bcf withdrawal, per a survey conducted by S&P Global Commodity Insights. The decrease compared with the five-year (2019-2023) average net shrinkage of 89 Bcf and last year’s decline of 23 Bcf for the reported week.
The latest draw puts total natural gas stocks at 3,336 Bcf, which is 436 Bcf (15%) above the 2023 level and 348 Bcf (11.6%) higher than the five-year average.
The total supply of natural gas averaged 110.8 Bcf per day, down a marginal 0.1 Bcf per day on a weekly basis due to a decrease in dry production, almost offset by higher shipments from Canada.
Meanwhile, daily consumption rose to 131.2 Bcf from 126.2 Bcf in the previous week, mainly reflecting strength in residential/commercial usage and higher power burn, to go with a pickup in exports to Mexico.
Natural Gas Prices Finish Sharply Higher Natural gas prices surged last week following the higher-than-expected inventory decrease. Futures for February delivery — ended Friday at $3.31 on the New York Mercantile Exchange, surging some 14.5% from the previous week’s closing. The jump in natural gas realization is also the result of a pullback in supply and predictions of colder weather.
As is the norm with natural gas, changes in temperature and weather forecasts can lead to price swings. With forecasts of cold arctic blasts in the days ahead, usage of the commodity to generate electricity is likely to be strong.
Apart from bullish weather conditions, natural gas has been pushed higher by signs of curtailment in domestic output. According to energy services provider Baker Hughes, the U.S. natural gas rig count — a pointer to where production is headed — is down some 22% from last year. Industry observers believe this could set the stage for a pullback in near-term drilling and supplies.
Meanwhile, a stable demand catalyst in the form of continued strong LNG feedgas deliveries is supporting natural gas. LNG shipments for export from the United States have been elevated for months, reaching record levels due to environmental reasons and Europe’s endeavor to move away from its dependence on Russian natural gas supplies due to the war in Ukraine.
Final Thoughts Despite last couple of week’s healthy increase, the natural gas market remains an oversupplied one. As a matter of fact, it endured a torrid year in 2023, as prices tumbled more than 40%, briefly breaking below the $2 threshold for the first time since 2020.
Based on several factors, the space is currently quite unpredictable and spooked by the sudden changes in weather and production patterns. As such, investors are clueless about what to do. As of now, the lingering uncertainty over the fuel means that they should preferably hold on to fundamentally strong stocks like Range Resources , Coterra Energy and Cheniere Energy .
Range Resources: RRC is a leading operator in the prolific Appalachian Basin — a premier natural gas play — with huge inventories of low-risk drilling sites that are likely to provide production for several decades. About 68% of the Zacks #3 Rank (Hold) company’s total output is natural gas.
You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank (Strong Buy) stocks here .
Range Resources beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate for earnings in each of the trailing four quarters, with the average being 33.6%. Valued at around $7.5 billion, RRC has gained 22.6% in a year.
Coterra Energy: It is an independent upstream operator primarily engaged in the exploration, development and production of natural gas. Headquartered in Houston, TX, the firm owns some 183,000 net acres in the gas-producing Marcellus Shale of the Appalachian Basin. The Zacks Rank #3 company churned out an average of 2,204 million cubic feet on a daily basis from these assets in 2022.
Coterra beat the Zacks Consensus Estimate for earnings in each of the trailing four quarters, the average being 11.8%. Valued at around $19.2 billion, CTRA has risen 1.9% in a year.
Cheniere Energy: Being the first company to receive regulatory approval to export LNG from its 2.6 billion cubic feet per day Sabine Pass terminal, Cheniere Energy enjoys a distinct competitive advantage.
Cheniere Energy has a projected earnings growth rate of 602.3% for the current year. The Zacks Consensus Estimate for this #3 Ranked natural gas exporter’s 2023 earnings has been revised 2.4% upward over the past 60 days. LNG shares have gone up 5.5% in a year.
